# Lebenslauf

```{r}
CV <- readxl::read_excel("C:/DefaultWD/CV-Data.xlsx") %>%
  mutate(
    across(contains(c("Start", "Ende")), ~ str_remove_all(.x, pattern = "\"")),
    across(contains(c("Start", "Ende")), ~ as.Date(.x)),
  )
  
plot_ly(
  data = CV,
  type = "scatter",
  mode = "lines+markers",
  x = ~Start,
  y = ~Wert,
  color = ~Thema,
  text = ~Bezeichnung,
  hovertemplate = "Ab %{x}<br>%{text}<extra></extra>"
)
```

# Interessen

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go

Interests = pd.read_excel(
  "C:/DefaultWD/CV-Data.xlsx",
  sheet_name = "Interests"
  )
Categories = pd.unique(Interests.Bezeichnung)

fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Scatterpolar(
      r=Interests[Interests["Thema"]=="Interesse"].Wert,
      theta=Categories,
      fill='toself',
      name='Interesse'
))
fig.add_trace(go.Scatterpolar(
      r=Interests[Interests["Thema"]=="Erfahrung"].Wert,
      theta=Categories,
      fill='toself',
      name="Erfahrung"
))
fig.update_layout(
  polar=dict(
    radialaxis=dict(
      visible=True,
      range=[0, 5]
    )),
  showlegend=False
)
fig.show()
```
